sect1.title: NULL
sect1.para: The special &null; value represents a variable with no value. &null; is the only possible value of type null.
A variable is considered to be null if:

listitem.para: it has been assigned the constant &null;.
it has not been set to any value yet.

sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.para: There is only one value of type null, and that is the case-insensitive constant &null;.
See also the functions is_null and unset.

sect2.title: Casting to &null;
sect2.para: Casting a variable to null using (unset) $var will not remove the variable or unset its value. It will only return a &null; value.
